results.title: Thirty seconds over Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy, Van Johnson and Robert Mitchum in his first leading role star in this classic World War II thriller based on the real-life diary of an American pilot (Ted Lawson) who was involved in the first American air raids on Japan. Lieutenant Colonel James Doolittle (Spencer Tracy) is the tough and inspiring mastermind of the historic crew of the “Ruptured Duck”, commanded by Captain Ted Lawson (Van Johnson). Lawson’s daydreams of the bride he left behind are intertwined with the nightmarish terrors of a tense Pacific crossing, thunderous bombings and the fate of his men. This is not only an action filled, emotional, historical saga of the war in the Pacific but also a romantic tale of American patriotism at its best.

results.title: The Carpetbaggers
results.creator_credit: Edward Dmytryk, Joseph E. Levine and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The explosive and frank adaptation of the best-selling Harold Robbins novel stars George Peppard as the ruthless tycoon who, with amazing parallels to Howard Hughes, manages to build a multi-million dollar empire. Set in the 20s and 30s, it provides an insight into life in Hollywood, filled with “booze and broads”. The plot centres on the eternal themes of greed, corruption, power, passion and love. The noteworthy cast also includes Elizabeth Ashley, Lew Ayres, Martin Balsam, Archie Moore, Martha Hyer, Leif Erickson, and Alan Ladd in his last performance. Costumes are by Dame Edith Head and music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: The Three faces of Eve
results.creator_credit: Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Joanne Woodward, in a performance which earned her the Oscar for Best Actress, plays Eve White, a mousy withdrawn housewife with multiple personalities. After startling her husband by behaving completely out of character, and having blackouts, Eve visits a psychiatrist, played by Lee J. Cobb. From these sessions, emerges the personality of Eve Black, a sexy, uninhibited woman who expresses those parts of Eve White’s personality which she has suppressed. Eventually, her third self emerges as Jane; an intelligent, sensible woman, who helps resolve and integrate the different facets of Eve’s personality into a whole and healthy human being. Based on a true story, this acclaimed drama explores the dimensions of the human mind.

results.title: Mississippi burning
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Robert F. Colesberry, Frederick Zollo, Rank Film Productions and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman and Willem Dafoe star as two FBI agents investigating the murder of three Civil Rights activists in a small Mississippi town in the early 1960’s. Parker drew on a real event for inspiration and this acclaimed film is tension filled. The violence and hatred which erupts from racial intolerance is a strong focus and is all the more shocking because it is endorsed and perpertrated by those representing the law. The excellent cast features Frances McDormand as the wife of the corrupt Deputy Sherriff, Stephen Toblowsky as head Klansman Townley and Michael Rooker who gives a chilling performance as the violent Klansman Frank. A strong point of the film’s script is the developing relationship between the two FBI men who come from different backgrounds with conflicting ideas. Their relationship evolves from mutual distrust to one of respect, and ultimately their combined forces enable them to reveal the truth about the murders.

results.title: The Robe
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Frank Ross and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Rome - 33 A.D., the headstrong tribune Gallio, (Richard Burton), offends the Emperor’s nephew Caligula, (Jaye Robinson), and is banished with his garrison and Greek slave Demetrius, (Victor Mature) to Jerusalem. At the Crucifixion, he wins Christ’s robe, but later as Jesus’s last words echo in his brain, he is driven half mad with fear and guilt. The slave Demetrius, becomes a Christian and takes the robe. The story of how Marcellus regains the robe, sanity and salvation aided by his true love Diana, (Jean Simmons), unfolds in this spectacular epic.

results.title: The Dirty dozen
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Kenneth Hyman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A tough U.S. Army Major trains a violent group of criminals for one of the most bizarre and difficult combat assignments - a suicide mission! Their task is to infilitrate a protected German retreat, a chateau in occupied France, where the upper echelon of Generals relax. Getting in and staying alive will not be easy and the action is relentless in this extraordinarly explosive suspense film. The all-star cast includes Lee Marvin, Charles Bronson, Jim Brown, Telly Savalas, Trini Lopez, Donald Sutherland, Ernest Borgnine, Richard Jaeckel, George Kennedy, Ralph Meeker and Robert Ryan.

results.title: Zulu
results.creator_credit: Cy Endfield, Sir Stanley Baker, Diamond Films, Joseph E. Levine and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the most popular British films of the 1960’s, “Zulu” is based on the true story of the defence of Rorke’s Drift in 1879. In this battle, 1200 men of the South Wales Borderers confronted four thousand attacking Zulu warriors. A stunning, historically accurate, battle picture starring the great British actors Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins and Michael Caine in his first screen role. A movie of “epic” proportions, the long and bloody battle is depicted in meticulous detail. The Zulus, who had never seen a motion picture, were shown an old Roy Rogers western to assist their performance. The Zulu chief is played by the real-life Chief Buthelezzi.

results.title: Outland
results.creator_credit: Peter Hyams, Richard Roth and The Ladd Company
results.brief_description: On Io, the innermost moon of Jupiter, the volcanic landscape is desolate. For the Con-Am 27 mining colony, populated by misfits and losers, it is home. Violence bubbles benath the surface, ready to explode. Federal District Marshall, William T. O’Niel, (Sean Connery), is sent to investigate the grisly, frenzied deaths amongst the miners, and must struggle alone in the pursuit of truth. This is a grim view of the future, where productivity takes precendence over humanity.

results.title: The Dogs of war
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Larry Dewaay and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This rivetting adaptation of Frederick Forsyth’s best-selling novel of the same name stars Christopher Walken and Tom Berenger as mercenary soldiers involved in the overthrow of a corrupt black African dictatorship. An intricate game ensues where double cross is the rule and the strike force they have organised find themselves caught between the shadowy international cartel who hired them and the dictator they are sworn to depose. The story focuses with chilling accuracy on the perilous lives of mercenaries, soldiers for hire, and the dirty battles they fight, often impervious to the morality of the assignment and its political integrity.

results.title: Pale rider
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood stars in this classic tale of right, wrong and retribution which takes place in a corrupt and violent gold rush town. The local miners are trying to fend off a take-over attempt from a powerful mining syndicate. Corporate mining boss, Coy LaHood offers the miners a deal: get out or be carried out. The miners have little choice until a mysterious stranger rides into town. The miners call him the Preacher. La Hood hires a band of thugs to kill the Preacher and the miners, but even though he pays in gold he hasn’t reckoned on the Preacher, who pays off in lead! Dark, funny and quietly sophisticated, “Pale Rider” reinterprets the Western in a manner that shamelessly combines melodrama, myth and irony.
